info.title: OpenAPI Meetzy
info.description: A sample API that uses a plant store as an example to demonstrate features in the OpenAPI specification

post.description: API that start a call using a pre-trained playbook.

get.description: Returns data about a specific call.
API that get the list of calls made by users.

phone.description: The phone to call with country prefix (e.g. +34600000000).

playbook_id.description: The id of the playbook you want to use to make the call. You can get the list of playbooks using your dashboard (/playbook endpoint will be available soon).

voice_id.description: The number of the voice to use (values: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7) - Default 6.

voice_model.description: Choose from our speech models: - 'fast' (less latency, nice voices) or 'human' (our natural sounding voices - (beta)) - Default model: 'human'

language.description: The language used by Meetzy during the call (values: ES, EN, FR, DE, IT, PT, ...) - Default ES.

interrupt.description: If the user can interrupt to the IA during the call - Default false.

<custom_param_1>.description: A custom param like email, firstname, lastname, email, program_of_insterest, etc. Meetzy will use this param to personalize the call.

<custom_param_2>.description: A custom param like email, firstname, lastname, email, program_of_insterest, etc. Meetzy will use this param to personalize the call.

<custom_param_N>.description: You can add as many custom params as you want. Meetzy will use this param to personalize the call.

id.description: The id of a the call

success.description: If the call started successfully or not

message.description: The message explaining the result of the call initiation

phone.description: The phone to call with country prefix (e.g. +34600000000).

playbook_id.description: The id of the playbook you want to use to make the call. You can get the list of playbooks using your dashboard (/playbook endpoint will be available soon).

voice_id.description: The number of the voice to use (values: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, random) - Default 3.

language.description: The language used by Meetzy during the call (values: ES, EN, FR, DE, IT, PT, ...) - Default ES.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

status.description: The status of the call (values: queued, ringing, completed, failed, routed).

sentiment:.description: The sentiment of the call (values: positive, neutral, negative, frustrated, angry, happy, sad, etc.

recorded:.description: If the call was recorded or not.

record_url:.description: The url of the recorded call.

created_at.description: The date and time when the call was created.

<custom_param_1>.description: A custom param you created when you created the call (like UTM, postal_code, program_of_insterest, etc.)

<custom_param_2>.description: A custom param you created when you created the call (like UTM, postal_code, program_of_insterest, etc.)

<custom_param_N>.description: You can add as many custom params as you want.

playbook_name.description: Name of the playbook used during the call.

playbook_id.description: Unique identifier of the playbook used during the call.

status.description: Current status of the call, possible values include: 'ringing', 'open', 'closed', 'no-answer', 'voicemail', 'busy', 'recall-scheduled', 'wrong-phone-format'.

duration.description: Duration of the call in seconds.

transcript.description: Full transcription of the call in HTML format.

summary.description: Brief summary of the conversation during the call.

data.description: Parameters received to initiate the call.

success.description: Indicates whether the objectives defined in the playbook were met.

recording.description: Indicates whether the call was recorded.

created_time.description: Timestamp for when the call was initiated, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in UTC (Z). For example, a created_time of '2024-01-28 16:16:56' corresponds to '2024-01-28 18:16:56' in Spain (UTC +2).

error.description: If the call started successfully or not

message.description: The message explaining why the call initiation failed
